Australian Gambling Statistics refer to the comprehensive data on gambling expenditure, participation, and associated harms within Australia. These statistics provide insights into the economic impact of gambling, the prevalence of gambling activities, and the extent of gambling-related issues among the population.

== Total Gambling Expenditure ==
The total gambling expenditure in Australia is estimated to be approximately $25-27 billion per year. This expenditure is distributed across various forms of gambling, including pokies, racing, sports betting, lotteries, and casinos.

== Per Capita Gambling Losses ==
Australia is among the countries with the highest per capita gambling losses, with approximately $1,000+ lost per adult each year.

== Participation Rates ==
Approximately 40-50% of Australian adults participate in gambling activities at least once per year, with lotteries being the most common form of gambling.

== Problem Gambling Prevalence ==
The prevalence of problem gambling in Australia is estimated as follows:

* Problem gamblers: 0.5-1%
* Moderate risk: 1-2%
* Low risk: 3-4%

== BetStop Registrations ==
Since August 2023, there have been significant registrations on BetStop, Australia's national self-exclusion register.
